text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. Infinix shattered smartphone design barriers July 25, 2025. The HOT 60 Pro Plus measures just 5.95mm thick, officially becoming the world's slimmest 3D-curved smartphone while packing a stunning curved AMOLED display that puts style-conscious Android users on notice. A New Standard: World's Slimmest 3D-Curved Smartphone This isn't just another phone launch. The HOT 60 Pro Plus rewrites engineering rules with its record-breaking 5.95mm profile that somehow accommodates a gorgeous 6.78-inch curved AMOLED screen. Vibrant colors pop from the 1.5K resolution display. The 144Hz refresh rate delivers buttery-smooth scrolling that makes every swipe feel premium. Trendsetters finally have their dream device: cutting-edge visuals wrapped in an impossibly thin package that practically begs for attention. Infinix Engineering Marvel: How Infinix Pulled Off the 5.95mm Profile Creating this ultra-slim masterpiece required serious innovation. Infinix custom-engineered ten critical components, redesigning everything from SIM trays to speakers to fit the impossibly thin frame. The aerospace-grade aluminum mid-frame provides structural integrity while ultra-thin Corning Gorilla Glass 7i delivers robust scratch and drop protection. At just 155g, advanced heat dissipation and smart structural design prove that thin doesn't mean fragile. Every millimeter was fought for and won. Infinix Light on Weight, Big on Battery Slim phones usually sacrifice battery life. Not this one. The 5160mAh battery uses revolutionary thin non-silicon-doped technology, cramming more power into less space than anyone thought possible. Lab tests prove this beast can handle up to 1800 charge cycles while retaining at least 80 percent battery health. 45W FastCharge rockets you to 50 percent in just 23 minutes. Power users won't be left hanging. Infinix Design That Pops: Colors, Cameras, and Detail Visual impact comes standard. Over ten color options include the stunning Coral Tides gradient that shifts and shimmers with every angle. Want something unique? The Scent Weave Leather edition actually includes infused fragrance for a multi-sensory experience that goes beyond typical smartphone territory. The sugar-cube-inspired camera module appears to float with futuristic Halo Lighting. Refined curves provide comfortable grip while the ultra-thin fiberglass back panel maintains durability without bulk. Under the Hood: Serious Performance and Smart Features MediaTek's Helio G200 chip debuts here. Combined with 8GB RAM and 256GB storage, multitasking becomes effortless even with the slimmest profile in the industry. Eleven thermal layers plus upgraded graphite slash chipset temperatures by up to 5 degrees, keeping performance cool under pressure. The 50MP Sony IMX882 rear camera captures sharp, vivid shots in any lighting condition. AI RAW processing and 2X lossless zoom deliver results that rival much more expensive devices. In-display fingerprint reading and Android 15 with XOS 15.1.1 bring cutting-edge AI features wrapped in a refreshed interface. Availability and Why It Matters Global launch begins July 25 starting at just $150. This price point makes flagship design accessible to everyone, not just premium buyers. Three Android upgrades and five years of security updates mean your investment stays current long-term, making this the smart choice for trend-forward users who refuse to compromise on either style or substance. Infinix just threw down the gauntlet. The HOT 60 Pro Plus proves ultra-slim design doesn't require sacrificing functionality, and its record-breaking profile puts established brands on notice. This device signals a new era for midrange Android phones where premium aesthetics meet accessible pricing, and competitors will scramble to match what Infinix has achieved. With over a decade's experience covering the world of Android and having reviewed more devices than he can count, Peter is excited about where the world of tech is heading. He is currently packing the Oppo Find X8 Pro, OnePlus Pad 2, and an ASUS Chromebook Plus. Previous Post

Infinix shattered smartphone design barriers July 25, 2025. The HOT 60 Pro Plus measures just 5.95mm thick, officially becoming the world's slimmest 3D-curved smartphone while packing a stunning curved AMOLED display that puts style-conscious Android users on notice.

A New Standard: World's Slimmest 3D-Curved Smartphone

This isn't just another phone launch. The HOT 60 Pro Plus rewrites engineering rules with its record-breaking 5.95mm profile that somehow accommodates a gorgeous 6.78-inch curved AMOLED screen.

Vibrant colors pop from the 1.5K resolution display. The 144Hz refresh rate delivers buttery-smooth scrolling that makes every swipe feel premium. Trendsetters finally have their dream device: cutting-edge visuals wrapped in an impossibly thin package that practically begs for attention.

Engineering Marvel: How Infinix Pulled Off the 5.95mm Profile

Creating this ultra-slim masterpiece required serious innovation.

Infinix custom-engineered ten critical components, redesigning everything from SIM trays to speakers to fit the impossibly thin frame. The aerospace-grade aluminum mid-frame provides structural integrity while ultra-thin Corning Gorilla Glass 7i delivers robust scratch and drop protection.

At just 155g, advanced heat dissipation and smart structural design prove that thin doesn't mean fragile. Every millimeter was fought for and won.

Light on Weight, Big on Battery

Slim phones usually sacrifice battery life. Not this one.

The 5160mAh battery uses revolutionary thin non-silicon-doped technology, cramming more power into less space than anyone thought possible. Lab tests prove this beast can handle up to 1800 charge cycles while retaining at least 80 percent battery health.

45W FastCharge rockets you to 50 percent in just 23 minutes. Power users won't be left hanging.

Design That Pops: Colors, Cameras, and Detail

Visual impact comes standard. Over ten color options include the stunning Coral Tides gradient that shifts and shimmers with every angle.

Want something unique? The Scent Weave Leather edition actually includes infused fragrance for a multi-sensory experience that goes beyond typical smartphone territory.

The sugar-cube-inspired camera module appears to float with futuristic Halo Lighting. Refined curves provide comfortable grip while the ultra-thin fiberglass back panel maintains durability without bulk.

Under the Hood: Serious Performance and Smart Features

MediaTek's Helio G200 chip debuts here. Combined with 8GB RAM and 256GB storage, multitasking becomes effortless even with the slimmest profile in the industry.

Eleven thermal layers plus upgraded graphite slash chipset temperatures by up to 5 degrees, keeping performance cool under pressure.

The 50MP Sony IMX882 rear camera captures sharp, vivid shots in any lighting condition. AI RAW processing and 2X lossless zoom deliver results that rival much more expensive devices. In-display fingerprint reading and Android 15 with XOS 15.1.1 bring cutting-edge AI features wrapped in a refreshed interface.

Availability and Why It Matters

Global launch begins July 25 starting at just $150.

This price point makes flagship design accessible to everyone, not just premium buyers. Three Android upgrades and five years of security updates mean your investment stays current long-term, making this the smart choice for trend-forward users who refuse to compromise on either style or substance.

Infinix just threw down the gauntlet. The HOT 60 Pro Plus proves ultra-slim design doesn't require sacrificing functionality, and its record-breaking profile puts established brands on notice. This device signals a new era for midrange Android phones where premium aesthetics meet accessible pricing, and competitors will scramble to match what Infinix has achieved.

With over a decade's experience covering the world of Android and having reviewed more devices than he can count, Peter is excited about where the world of tech is heading. He is currently packing the Oppo Find X8 Pro, OnePlus Pad 2, and an ASUS Chromebook Plus.
